com.edugility.throwables
Class Throwables

java.lang.Object
  com.edugility.throwables.Throwables

A class to assist with processing Throwable instances.

Returns the "deepest" cause reachable from the supplied Throwable.

Parameters:
t - the Throwable to investigate; may be null
Returns:
the "deepest" cause reachable from the supplied Throwable, or null

toList

public static final List<Throwable> toList(Throwable throwable)
Creates and returns a somewhat esoteric view of the supplied Throwable and its causal chain as a List.

In the simplest case, where the supplied Throwable itself does not implement the Iterable interface, the List returned by this method is equal in behavior to ThrowableList.

In the more complicated case where the supplied Throwable does implement Iterable, each Throwable in the iteration is added to the List that will be returned, followed immediately by its causal chain. SQLException is an example of a Throwable that also implements Iterable; ThrowableChain is another.

In cases where the Throwables returned by an Iterable Throwable are also contained somewhere in a causal chain, the returned List may contain duplicate elements.

In general, if you are interested only in viewing the causal chain of a given Throwable as a List then creating and using a ThrowableList may fit your needs better.

This method never returns null.

This method allocates a new List when called.

Parameters:
throwable - the Throwable in question; may be null
Returns:
an unmodifiable List of Throwables; never null; the return value will always contain the supplied Throwable as its first element unless the supplied Throwable is null
See Also:
ThrowableList

firstInstance

public static final <T extends Throwable> T firstInstance(Throwable t,
                                                          Class<T> throwableClass)
Returns the first Throwable in the causal chain of the supplied Throwable (or the supplied Throwable itself) that is an instance of the supplied Class.

This method may return null.

Parameters:
t - the Throwable whose causal chain should be investigated; may be null in which case null will be returned
throwableClass - the Class whose Class.isInstance(Object) method will be called; if null then null will be returned
Returns:
the first Throwable in the causal chain that is an instance of the supplied Class, or null

lastInstance

public static final <T extends Throwable> T lastInstance(Throwable t,
                                                         Class<T> throwableClass)
Returns the last Throwable in the causal chain of the supplied Throwable (or the supplied Throwable itself) that is an instance of the supplied Class.

This method may return null.

Parameters:
t - the Throwable whose causal chain should be investigated; may be null in which case null will be returned
throwableClass - the Class whose Class.isInstance(Object) method will be called; if null then null will be returned
Returns:
the last Throwable in the causal chain that is an instance of the supplied Class, or null
